description: Enterprise techniques used by TA505, ATT&CK group G0092 v1.0
name: TA505 (G0092)

techniques.comment: [TA505](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0092) has used malware to gather credentials from Internet Explorer.
[TA505](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0092) has downloaded additional malware to execute on victim systems.
[TA505](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0092) has signed payloads with code signing certificates from Thawte and Sectigo.
[TA505](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0092) has leveraged rundll32.exe to execute malicious DLLs.
[TA505](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0092) has used msiexec to download and execute malicious Windows Installer files.

[TA505](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0092) has used lures to get users to click links in emails and attachments, enable content in malicious attachments, and execute malicious files contained in archives. For example, [TA505](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0092) makes their malware look like legitimate Microsoft Word documents, .pdf and/or .lnk files.
[TA505](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0092) has password-protected malicious Word documents and used base64 encoded PowerShell commands.
[TA505](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0092) has used malware to gather credentials from FTP clients and Outlook.
[TA505](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0092) has used a wide variety of ransomware, such as Locky, Jaff, Bart, Philadelphia, and GlobeImposter, to encrypt victim files and demand a ransom payment.
[TA505](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0092) has used PowerShell, VBS, and JavaScript for code execution.
[TA505](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0092) has used PowerShell to download and execute malware and reconnaissance scripts.
[TA505](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0092) has sent spearphishing emails containing malicious links.
[TA505](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0092) has leveraged malicious Word documents that abused DDE.
[TA505](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0092) has used spearphishing emails with malicious attachments to initially compromise victims.
